column1: length ball, outside off, left alone, collected by the shoelaces. No carry
length ball on the pads, worked wide of mid-on for one
gets a stride in to defend a length ball back to the bowler
this is pitched further up and there is no movement in the air. Stirling drives confidently off the front foot, but straight to mid-off
this time he looks to drive on the up. Seems to have made up his mind about this pitch. Finds the man at cover, but seems like he fancies this pitch
this one moves in a little, Stirling makes an adjustment despite the early forward movement, and helps it for a single to midwicket
the slowness of the pitch is at it. Wafadar digs it short, Stirling goes for the pull, but the ball arrives ever so slowly to take the bottom edge onto his body
driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
pitched up, slight shape in, Stirling moves forward and plays this watchfully and with a slightly open face. Man at cover does the fielding
gets a big stride in, this is not quite a half-volley but is close to one. And wide too. He throws his hands at it, keeps the ball down, and goes square of cover for four
Stirling looks in the mood. He is walking down the wicket, and even though this is just short of a length, he punches it through cover for four more. Feels confident enough to hit on the up
watchfully defended this time as Wafadar gets closer to the off stump
length just outside off, blocked on the front foot
appeal for catch behind is turned down. Length ball skids across the corridor and the outside edge as he looks to defend on the front foot
falls short of first slip. Length ball has him jabbing on the front foot. Thick edge but the slowness of the pitch evident
length, swung into the pads on and he allows it to come on before tickling it fine
length and curving in to rap him on the pad. He's too late on the flick and another appeal is turned down
length outside off, gets a big stride in and punched to mid-on's right
slants back in to beat the forward push and hit him on the box. Ouch!
angles one back into middle from wide of the crease, pushed to mid-on
delightful punch into the covers, just the half press forward as he eased it on the up
gets a thick inside edge to deep square leg
looks to tuck it square, ball thuds into the thigh pad and rolls into the leg side
defends this towards mid-on
right behind the line of this length ball as he pushes it gently back down the pitch
huge appeal for caught behind, not out says S Ravi. This drew him forward, left him late and Stirling had a poke at that.
smacked on the up through extra cover, sublime
has a good look at this as he defends from the crease
crashes this to the left of mid-off. What timing, what punch
leans into the drive and caresses this through cover point. Too full, top shot. Delightful timing
goes too full, Porterfield shows the full face of the bat to belt this back past the bowler. Mid-off had no chance
deflects off the thigh pad to the off side as he tries to work it to the leg side.
length ball angling away, defended back
beaten as he looks to pull in front of square, this kept a hint low
drawn forward by the length, plays outside the line and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad.
pokes and misses, good ball.
plays all around this incoming delivery, misses. Hit on the pad with the angle taking it down
gets well forward as he eases this to mid-on
solidly bunted back
stays behind the line and defends
bowl full on off stump, Stirling is well forward as he defends into the covers
too much width, crashed but an excellent stop at extra cover to save four runs
nicely tossed up, smashed to short cover
drift in from round the stumps, Porterfield struck on the pad as he pushes forward but the impact was outside off
nice loop, spins away off a length outside off, left alone
lunges forward and smothers the spin
defends with his bat close to the pad
gets a good stride forward and defends.
attacks the stumps by going full, Stirling falls over a hint as he pushes to mid-on
edged but falls safe. Pokes with hard hands, fortunately it goes to ground as Shahzad moves to his right to take it on the bounce
works this length ball to midwicket
nicked and gone! String of 20 dot balls and then Stirling pushes at one that leaves him late to get a faint nick. Gleefully accepted.
Lovely movement back in, pushes half forward to get a thickish inside edge towards midwicket
nicks, gets his first runs in Tests through a fat edge past the slip cordon. Lucky runs but anything to just get off the mark, isn't it?
covers the line, gets forward and defends.
steps out and then lunges a little more to stab that away
toe-ends an attempted cut to short cover, no room to play the shot

squared up, struck on the pad and gone! Nabi gets this to drift back in from round the stumps, the length is just a touch full and Porterfield makes the grave mistake of playing back. He's squared up in doing so as the ball bites off the deck to strike him on the right pad. Didn't have much distance to travel and he's been given out lbw
lunges forward and keeps out this full delivery.
good stride forward as he keeps out this tossed up delivery
defends this full delivery into the covers, feet glued to the crease in doing so.
length, just outside off, defended.
back of length outside off, left alone
squirts this off a thick inside edge to mid-on
this is an absolute cracker! The off-stump has been flattened. Comes back in a long way after pitching and sneaks through the inside edge to hit the pad and crash into the stumps.
slips one down leg in trying to bowl a big inswinger, he tickles one past the keeper.
beaten as he looks to work this behind square on the leg side, good take by the keeper.
squirts one off a thick outside edge to short third man. Shahzad with a laboured effort at slip,was never going to get there. Didn't look like getting there.
tucks this with the spin to square leg.
defended into the off side
goes right back and across as he bunts back
appeal for a catch at short leg, but the umpire reckons this came off the pad. Big-spinning offbreak again
nice and full on the stumps, defended to the covers.
eases this short of length delivery to point
big inswinger, KOB is overbalanced as he looks to work it to the leg side. Convincing appeal, but S Ravi says not out. Good decision too, this would've missed leg.
flayed on the up between cover and point, too much width this time
toe-ends this cut into the covers, met the ball very early.
imperious! Balance and timing is superb as he picks this leg-side half-volley to the square leg boundary
strikes first ball! It's the googly which he doesn't pick at all, plays down the wrong line and chops on through an inside edge. What a start for the superstar, Ireland are crumbling.
beaten by one that goes straight on. This one was slightly shorter in length

struck full on the toe, gone. There's absolutely no application whatsoever. What injury? At the moment, it looks like Rashid can hobble in on one leg and still pick wickets. All be said, this was a full toss that should've been put away, he missed the flick completely, struck on leg. It may have missed leg? Touch harsh you may think
skids one across, defended from the crease
defended from the crease.
gets to the pitch and squirts to the off side.
floats it full outside off, KOB has a good look at it and leaves
skids back in, keeps low and KOB is beaten as he pokes at this, on the bounce to the keeper
gets forward and works this with the angle towards short midwicket
length ball on middle and off, turns this gently into the leg side.
stands tall and uses the width to punch to cover
slants one back into off, he gets a good stride forward and defends.
length on off stump, blocked down the pitch
full outside off, gets close to the pitch and defends
full at off stump, defended into the off side
full toss outside off, driven straight to backward point
length ball slid in at an off stump line. Defended off the inside half
googly at a length outside off, beaten on the outside edge
length and in at off stump, defended into the leg side
length and angled into the corridor. Defended off the back foot
can't grab that down leg side. It was off the pad and the keeper was lunging low to his left as this died on him. A full ball down leg side
good length, just outside off. Gets behind the line and defends
length and angled in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
short of a length and skidding into the thigh guard. He looks to flick that and is late
full toss on middle stump, leans in, watches it closely and tucks it wide of mid-on
full on off stump, dead-batted down the pitch
googly at off stump, defended to leg slip off the inside half
full on middle stump, tapped back down the pitch
yorker length at middle stump, jammed back to the bowler
length down leg side, off the pad to leg slip as he gets on the back foot to flick
full and pushed across off from wide of the crease. Swishes and misses
length and rising up at the thigh as he looks to flick. Beaten on the inside edge
driving length just outside off, but Thompson happy to leave at the moment
short of a length across off stump, left alone
length at middle stump, big lbw appeal as he looks to flick against the angle. But that pitched outside leg
full on leg stump and he misses on the flick again. Pings into the square leg region off the front pad
googly at middle stump, defended into the off side
full outside off, jabbed to point off the front foot
full toss outside off, driven straight to mid-off
length outside off, defended to slip's left with an open face
yorker length outside off, jammed into the covers
beaten. Googly at a length on off stump, gets forward to defend as this fizzes past the outside edge
big appeal and given! Beats the inside edge and catches him in front of middle stump as KOB plants the foot across off stump to defend. Ireland are disappearing rapidly here, it's a frenzy
length outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
yorker length outside off, poked down the pitch
full on off stump, defended into the leg side
full on off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
length on off stump, defended off the front foot
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
appeal for catch behind, but not out says the umpire. This is a full ball down leg side and he hits the pitch with the bat as he looks to flick
length outside off, punched firmly to mid-off's left and a misfield there gives him his first Test runs after 27 balls
quick full toss outside off, mistimed drive straight to mid-off
length at off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
low full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep square

taken at short leg! Length ball slanted in from around the wicket. Gets forward and pokes with hard hands to get an edge onto pad that pops up for short leg, straight into his body and not too many movements needed
length and in at off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
tossed up wide outside off, opens the face and drives through backward point
length on off stump, blocked into the covers
length and pushed through quickly. Defended on the back foot
length on off stump, defended off the inside half
short and very wide outside off, cut to extra cover
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, pushed to mid-off on the front foot
full outside off, driven to extra cover on the front foot
full and flat outside off, dead-batted into the covers
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length and in at leg stump, flies past short leg off the inside edge
full on middle stump, pushed down the pitch on the front foot
full and drifted in at off stump, defended with the turn
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the back foot
short of a length just outside off, hurriedly cut to extra cover
full on off stump, jabbed to mid-off on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
inside edge past off stump and between the keeper's legs. This length ball is pushed through quick and skids on as he shapes to cut. Late on it in the end
length on off stump, defended to extra cover
short of a length outside off, defended on the back foot
short of a length outside off, defended to cover off the back foot
length on off stump, pushed through flat. Defended with the turn to cover
tossed up outside off, defended to point on the front foot
full on off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
length outside off, defended to point
floated up at a length outside off, blocked on the front foot

lbw appeal turned down. That looks very out on replay. He gets on to turn back in from outside off, while it's been going away all this while. Beats the inside edge and catches him in front of off stump
length at leg stump, another appeal for lbw is turned down. This time it might have been pitching outside leg
full and wide outside off, left alone
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, chopped to point
length and skids past the outside edge as he gets forward to defend
length at leg stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
overpitched wide outside off, looks to drive, gets it off the under-edge to cover point
full and just outside off, gentle push to cover
length outside off, tapped to point on the front foot
short and in at leg stump, swivels to pull to fine leg
lunges forward and dabs this away-drifter.
nice and full on middle, kept out
bowled him! Where's the application. First in Tests for Salamkheil. He goes for an expansive sweep by trying to fetch it from outside off but the length isn't quite there and he chops on.
rooted to the crease as he works this length ball on middle to the leg side
drifts in a full delivery from wide of the crease, it's the wrong'un which he picks off the hand and blocks.
leans into the drive, squeezes it to backward point
skiddy length ball on middle, defended
lovely extra cover drive to the man at the edge of the ring
scoots low, beaten! Harmless length ball angling away, could've troubled the batsman if it was on the stumps
squeezes the drive to mid-off and scampers a quick single
excellent leave, in that off-stump corridor where the batsman can only drive if he is happy to hit on the up
attacks the stumps, bowls full, this one rolls off the inside edge towards midwicket
flatter one on middle and leg, worked behind square for a single
drifts a full delivery across, he gets to the pitch of the ball and blocks
reaches out to drive but can't get to the pitch, gets a thick inside edge back to the bowler
driven wide of point for a quick single
flatter length ball outside off, works to midwicket
defended from the crease.
short of length delivery outside off, bunted into the off side
gets a bottom-edge as he pushes at this delivery, doesn't carry to second slip
nice and full on off from wide of the crease, he gets a good stride forward and defends
good leave to a full delivery that is begging to be driven
uppish push to the covers, was in the air briefly
beaten as he lands a length ball outside off, keeps low again but this time Dockrell is late on an attempted glide to third man
in the air, but in the gap. Flatter delivery on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket
struck on the pad as he plays all around it, but this was sliding down. Confidently turned down by Illingworth
hint of width, he dabs this to the slip fielder. Shahzad the man
nice flight, too much flight in fact, gets forward and smothers this
shapes to cut but realises the width not quite there, chops it to the slips.
googly that spins in off a length, defended.
dug in short, Dockrell ducks under this without a hassle
gets on top of the bounce and fends safely
slower and fuller outside off, driven wide of cover for a quick single
bowls full, gets this to veer back in from round the wicket, defended carefully
slips this down leg, excellent work by the debutant keeper in diving to his left to stop. Easy runs for the picking, all Cameron-Dow needed was a tickle for four
length ball on middle, defended back
goes right back into the crease and defends
this one dips on him, bowled full the stumps, kept out somehow
lunges forward and smothers the spin
shortish on middle, defended back again
gets well forward and blocks
full and flat on the stumps, kept out once again
nicely tossed up on off from round the stumps, defended
squirts this to the off side off a forward push
plays with the spin to silly point. Didn't commit himself fully forward to this delivery
drifts back into middle, he defends this into the leg side.
touch short and sliding into middle and leg, worked wide of square leg
touch short, he goes back and defends
touch fuller, on middle, tucked to the leg side
slips one in full, smothered back
defends this length delivery with soft hands to the off side.
flatter length delivery on middle and leg, nudged towards short midwicket
whips this to short fine leg
squeezes through the gap between keeper and slip. Not where he intended but runs nonetheless. This was too full, he was looking to carve this behind point
dip, spin and he beats the edge on the drive. Lovely from Nabi
flatter one on middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket
huge appeal, looked adjacent but S Ravi is unmoved. Stabs at this delivery but gets outside the line. But then the impact was bang in front of middle. Poor decision
tickled down leg, gets the direction wrong this time. Easy runs, frustration creeping in.
lunges forward and blocks
too full on the stumps, kept out again

wicket after 30 minutes of pure frustration. Decision to play across the line has cost him dear. This one pitched on leg, spun away and skid through to beat the bat. Was better off trying to play it back. Ireland nine down.
squeezes this yorker-length delivery to mid-on
too full on the stumps, kept out
sharp-turning legbreak, defended on the move as he presses forward.
driven hard but straight to mid-off
nudged wide of square leg for a single
too short, slipping down leg, worked fine towards fine leg. Easy runs but not something Afghanistan will fret over
nice and full on the stumps, squeezed back
breaks back in from middle and off, works this towards square leg
dabs this length ball on off to cover
plays it back to the bowler with soft hands
sees the flight and decides he's had enough. Lofts him superbly over the bowler's head. Nice timing, got as close to the delivery as he could.
slants one across on a length, punched to long-off
gets forward and defends with the spin to the off side
drifts in a quicker delivery from wide of the crease, worked to the leg side
too full, he works this with the angle to deep midwicket
tucks this full delivery to square leg
gets well forward and across as he keeps out this full delivery.
drift and turn, but he's got the line well covered in defence
squirted back off a leading edge. Was looking to play through midwicket, there's slow turn for Nabi this time
eased back towards mid-off, lazy effort from the fielder there. Shouldn't have been a single
spins back into middle and leg, tucked to the leg side
eases this full ball back down the pitch
beaten as he looks to work this behind square on the leg side
easy nudge down to mid-on as they jog the single
struck on the pad as he goes for a big sweep, but this pitched outside leg.
chops this down to mid-off, was looking to force it through the covers but didn't have room
too full, blasted back past the bowler to raise the 100. This was too easy, asking to be hit. Overpitched and he belted that. Mid-off was wide
lunges forward and blocks
punches this shortish delivery wide of mid-off
nice and full, he defends from the crease. Risky business
too short, he rocks back and slaps to long-off
defends this indrifter back to the bowler.
gets well forward, covers the line and defends.
steered wide of point, opened the bat face slightly to pick the gap, these are all handy runs
smothered back to the bowler.
walloped on the bounce to deep midwicket, this was sitting up for him to belt.
googly that's too short, he gets a thick edge to this push, short third man runs back to cut it off
mistimes the drive back to the bowler. This was there for him to go after, but got a thick inside edge. Rashid stops with his boot.
turns this length ball on middle wide of midwicket
tucks this wide of mid-on
skids one back in, Dockrell solidly behind as he keeps out
past the outside edge. Drifted in from around the wicket and climbing past the bat as he looks to defend
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
pumps it straight over the bowler. Lovely swing of the bat. Tossed up on off stump and he got right to the pitch of this before launching this straight to clear the boundary
length on leg stump, flicked to backward square
short of a length just outside off, hurried chop to extra cover's right
length on leg stump, hits the front pad as he looks to flick. Sliding down though
full outside off, dead-batted into the covers
short of a length just outside off, hurried chop straight to point
full outside off, blocked on the front foot

aerial but safely to mid-on's left. Early on the drive at this full ball at off stump. It's a chip between non-striker and fielder. He gives chase and tries to pull it back, but it loops back like a projectile because of the momentum and goes with him over the boundary
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
shout for lbw but there's an inside edge on this. Hurries into him as he looks to defend on the front foot
tossed up at a length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
slugs it over wide long-on. The wonders of getting to the pitch of the ball. This is lobbed up outside off but his stride to get there allows a nice, clean heave to clear the boundary
length on off stump, pushed down the pitch from the crease
length outside off, stabbed out to cover
googly outside off, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, defended into the off side on the front foot
googly skidding in at leg stump, gets on the back foot and pushes to mid-on
length ball skidded across off stump, opens the face and runs it to backward point
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full and wide outside off, left alone
length outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
full outside off, driven to long-off
short of a length on middle stump, backs away and drags this through square leg with a flat bat
yorker at middle stump, gets the front leg out of the way and jams it towards mid-on
full outside off, pushed to mid-off's right
length on middle stump, defended to midwicket off the front foot
tossed up at middle stump, defended on the front foot
full toss on middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
length outside off, punched to mid-off
full and down leg side, beaten on the flick. Another impressive take by Ikram down leg side. He's let nothing past him today
full outside off, driven to short extra
length outside off, pushed past the bowler's lazy attempt. Single at long-off
crunch! Full at off stump from around the wicket. Gets the front foot into the leg side and drills this over mid-on to bring up the fifty-run stand
and he has smoked this one! Length ball slanted in at middle stump. Backs away again and hoicks this through midwicket with a swivel
top edge lands safely to the keeper's right. Bouncer gets too big on him and he swipes hurriedly under it
length outside off, defended to cover point
length outside off, defended into the covers
full outside off, driven to mid-off
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side on the front foot
yorker at middle stump, dug out
full outside off, driven to mid-off
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, backs away and slaps it through cover. Used his reach for that one
length outside off, opens the face and runs it through point
at the stumps and poked into the leg side
length on leg stump, tickled fine off the pad
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
nicely put away. Dropped short at leg stump, gets low and uses his balance to swipe this to deep square's right
past the edge. Length ball, a googly, past the attempted block
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
full outside off, defended to extra cover's right
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked against the turn to short fine
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, backs away and chops it past short third man. Nice and late to beat the fielder
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
falls short of long-on. Tossed up on leg stump and he mistimes the attempted slog
googly at a length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full and just outside off, opens the face and runs it into the covers
yorker length outside off, jammed out to mid-off
googly outside off, defended on the front foot
yorker down leg side, can't get bat on the flick. And one's finally gone past the keeper too. Off his pad and into the fine boundary
length at middle stump, whipped to midwicket's right off the back foot. A dive from the fielder, can only parry it into the empty space behind the bowler
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up outside off, drills it to mid-off's left and completes the single that gives him his maiden Test fifty! And he's done it at No. 11 to keep his team in this contest
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
length outside off, left alone
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot

brilliant one-handed effort at deep midwicket, Murtagh walloped this pull and Rashid just couldn't get that to stick as he flung himself to the right. The catch was gone, but he still had the awareness to run back and put in a dive to prevent the boundary. Top effort. Pulled the ball back in and then went over the ropes. He was air borne when he pulled it back in.
punches on the up to cover
gentle dab into the point region for a quick single
thin inside edge but not taken. Murtagh looked to pull but played too early. Just the faintest of under-edges that whizzed past leg stump.
what a shot, punched on the up to mid-off

there's the wicket, finally. Draws him forward, gets it to leave him and induces the nick. It's all over, but this has been a terrific, terrific fightback by Ireland. Ahmadzai was brought back in precisely for this reason.
attacks the stumps straightaway with a full ball on middle, Shahzad squirts it off an inside edge to midwicket
bowls nice and full just outside off, gets this to jag back in, defended back as he gets well forward.
excellent leave to a full delivery just outside off. Three slips waiting or the edge
nice and full on the stumps again, defended solidly.
goes a long way forward and across as he defends towards mid-on
full and moving away just a hint from off stump, defended
goes back to a full delivery and defends, eliciting oohs and aahs from the close-in fielders
once again feet glued to the crease as he defends a length delivery that spins in
gets well forward and squirts this behind point for his first Test runs
nice flight and loop on middle, Shahzad gets forward and across as he defends back
fired full on the stumps, kept out
turns this with the spin to mid-on, had to lunge a long way forward again.
back of length outside off, punched to extra cover
bowls nice and full outside off, defended as he gets a good stride in
gets it to angle in and then nip away off the deck, defended back
gets right behind the line as he whips this wide of midwicket
draws him forward with the length, defended gently
goes full from wide of the crease, Shahzad falls over a hint as he defends back.
full, sharp turn from outside off, defended
gets to the pitch and defends back
driven wide of mid-off as they scamper a quick single
gets a long way forward and smothers this
goes full, in and around the off stump, blocked back. Big shot coming?
prefers to not throw his bat at this as he gets forward and defends. There was an invitation to go over the top.
works this incoming delivery towards square leg
nice and full on middle stump, shows the full face of the bat in defence.
in the off-stump channel, left alone. This one nipped away off the seam
touch ahead of length outside off, bunted into the covers
confident forward push, text book style, to this full delivery.
allows the ball to slide in as he defends carefully into the leg side
touch short, sharp turn off a length on middle, defended.
nice and full, he gets a step in to smother that
once again defended carefully
fired full and flat on off stump, kept out
this has been cracked behind point. Too short, he rocked back and gave it a thwack
looks to drill this back over the bowler's head but got too close to the pitch, played back
gentle full delivery on off, no swing whatsoever, defended towards mid-on
touch short and angling in, he hops across and defends
angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, defended back
goes full on off stump again, Ihsanullah is well forward as he keeps out this one

gorgeous straight drive, using his wrists as well to work this back down the ground after initially shaping to cover drive. All said, this was a half-volley asking to be put away. That should give Ihsanullah plenty of confidence
defended towards point
breaks back in from a length, defended
shortish and spinning in, bunted back
gets well forward and keeps out this full delivery
squeezed back to the bowler as he goes full
gets to the pitch and defends again to short leg
nudged with the spin to short fine leg
gets this full delivery to move away a hint, he covers the line and defends.
turns this full delivery to the short mid-on fielder
slower and fuller on the stumps, defended back
nice and full outside off, he stretches forward and keeps out
gets this to nip back in off a length, he defends with his bat close to the body
slides back in off a length, defended
goes back to play this slightly full delivery, no damage done.
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks.
pulled away, not not entirely off the middle. This one hurried onto him
gets outside the line of the stumps and defends.
stabbed away as he lunges forward to keep it out
turns this gently with the spin to short mid-on
full, straight and a hint of movement as it approaches the batsman, defended back
defends this full delivery to the cover region
nice and full on the stumps, kept out
defends this incoming delivery to midwicket
good stride forward as he defends
eased into t he gap at cover for a single
fired full on the stumps, defended back.
eased back down the pitch as he lunges forward
shortish and spinning back in, turned into the leg side.
picks the length early, rocks back and clobbers this pull to the midwicket boundary
goes back and across as he bunts this back.

clears the straight boundary and brings up fifty! Down the track quickly to meet this on the full and a strong hit to clear the straight boundary

looks to flay this behind point but gets a thick bottom edge and it's well taken by the wicketkeeper! Good knock, that bordered on the outrageous at times but that's the way he plays. He'll look to dance down and swipe you out of nowhere, then buckle down. Worked today.
punches this to short cover
goes full on middle and off, kept out somehow
caresses this full delivery into the covers
dances down the wicket to muscle this out of the ground, but can only toe-end this hoick to mid-on
swing and a miss, the ball beats the inside edge and dies low on the keeper, who fumbles and they take a bye
shows good defence as he goes right behind the line to defend this full delivery
stands tall and bunts this length delivery to cover point
driven but no timing, down to mid-off but they scamper a single
squeezes this full delivery into the off side
belts this on the up but straight to mid-off
cramped for room as he looks to cut, the ball gets big on him and deflects off the shoulder of the bat to Balbirnie at slip.

keeps a touch low, but Balbirnie somehow manages to keep out this full delivery
pitched up, this one's around the fifth stump, left alone
worked away with the angle to fine leg to get off the mark. Looks like his father, who is watching from the stands, is more relieved than him
slants a length delivery back in, defended back

tucks this with the spin, the short leg fielder stops it with his left leg.
gets a long way forward and smothers this
goes full again, this one skids through, he's rooted to the crease in defending that

length ball on middle and leg, defended with a straight bat to midwicket
pitched up, invites the drive but it's a touch wide outside off, left alone
authoritative drive to extra cover for a quick single
gets a good stride forward to cover the line of this nipbacker and defends with an angled bat face to point
doesn't commit himself fully forward, manages to keep out this full delivery on the stumps
firm push but straight to mid-off
gets a long way across and sweeps with the spin to short fine

turned with the spin to short midwicket
defends this sharp-turning off beak from the crease

chipped in the air, but just falls short of Rashid at midwicket

gets into a good position with the forward stride as he defends
gets this to angle in, balls nips away off the seam, left alone
punched into the gap at point, Balbirnie wanted a third, Stirling didn't. Good decision to not take it in the end. Afghan was late to hare across
gets well forward and smothers this
goes right back and across as he defends.
works with the spin to midwicket
turns this to short mid-on, played nicely with a spin
turns this with the spin to mid-on
length ball outside off, left alone

punched to mid-off again as he gets a good stride forward

touch short, steered into the off side
drifts in a legbreak from wide of the crease, defended

cut away, picked the googly well, hit it well but a good stop at point.

driven on the up to extra cover
nips back in off a length outside off, defended
scorching frontfoot drive but straight to cover

bowls it full around the fifth stump, left alone. Hint of movement in but this hardly carried to the keeper
good stride forward as he defends this length ball back to the bowler
thick inside edge onto the pad! Some movement in the air as he lands this length ball outside off, he could've so easily chopped on. Played this on the move

probing line just outside off, defende

good length on off stump, defended solidly.

defended to short mid-on

gently turns this towards square leg, where there's a misfield and they get a run they shouldn't have.

swept straight to square leg

'oooh,' is the shout from the Irish close-catchers but it's unwarranted as Rahmat blocks one on leg stump
quicker and shorter - the change in length draws Rahmat into a big shot but it's onto him a little too soon for the pull shot to work properly
lovely drift away from the right-hander as McBrine tosses it up. Ihsanullah lunges forward to defend
stays back to deal with the flatter delivery on middle and blocks
good stride towards the pitch of the ball on off stump and pushes to the left of the bowler
lures him to play outside off stump again with his drift, but Ihsanullah's reading the length well, and showing great restraint
steps forward and blocks outside off
loopy delivery - it's actually way too full - and Ihsanullah blunts it in front of off stump

at first glance, it seems too full to sweep, but Rahmat controls it superbly to bring up his second fifty-plus score of the game. Replays, though, clearly indicate the ball gives him enough leverage to the swing the bat across it - even if he was taking a risk, sweeping out of the rough
looks to defend a slow, tossed up delivery outside leg and gets a bit of an inside edge. Agonisingly for Ireland, it doesn't carry to short leg
presses forward to block on leg stump
looking to bowl into the rough means he'll have to pitch it outside leg and Rahmat is happy to kick it away
tosses it up on leg stump, Rahmat stops it from going further
loooads of flight outside off again and Ihsanullah is lulled into drying, and the dip on the ball makes him mistime to cover
shimmies down the pitch and basically yorks himself

beats the inside edge! It's the drift. That sexy drift. The ball hangs in the air outside off, tempting Ihsanullah to drive away from his body, suckering him to bring out the gap between bat and pad. Then the ball bites into the pitch and turns through to the keeper, missing off stump
rocks back to the flatter ball and whips it to midwicket
thunders down the track - making room to open up the off side - and clatters the tossed up delivery through extra cover. Brutal, and fairly effective
loops it up outside off, Ihsanullah blocks
strides forward to face the delivery pitching full and outside leg and defends it well

steps out of his crease to reach the loopy delivery on the full, preventing it from pitching in the rough outside leg and also smoking it to the midwicket boundary. Positive batting. Brilliant batting
defends on leg stump
pitches outside leg, so Rahmat lets it hit him
another shimmy down the pitch helps him get to the ball on the full and flick to long-on
opens the face as he steers the flighted delivery on middle stump through cover point

there's a deepish mid-on lurking, but Ihsanullah is buoyed by how close the target is. He can almost reach out and touch it, so he'll take the odd risk. Especially if he knows he can play shots like these, he prolly will. Charges of his his crease and launches Dockrell wide of mid-on
goes back to the predictably shorter ball and blocks
lunges forward outside off to defend
magnificent! He's down the pitch again, this time with the bat face perfectly straight, allowing his power to flow through, and it takes the ball clean over the straight boundary
this one's short and Ihsanullah is waiting for it, rocking back, making room and clattering it through the covers Fourteen runs off the over
tosses it up on leg stump, Rahmat blocks
scampers down the pitch again but this time Dockrell spots it and fires the ball in to cramp Rahmat. The batsman has to twist himself inside out to defend it
too short, and with him targeting outside leg, at that rough, this is hit-me bowling. And Rahmat does his bit, pulling the ball over midwicket
full and on off stump, drives to cover
cramps the advancing batsman again, but Rahmat is good enough to keep this one out too
loops it up on leg stump, Rahmat keeps it out. FYI, these two have put on 100-plus together now and the target is only 37 away
short and wide, he cracks it to deep point
ugly old full toss on leg stump, and Rahmat somehow treats this too with respect, deflecting it behind square leg
tosses it up on middle, Rahmat blocks
steps back to block a short of a length ball on middle and, as it skips behind square leg, he goes through for the single
gets forward to block outside off
full toss, which he drags from outside off, all the way to wide long-on. That's a maiden Test fifty for Ihsanullah and he'll want to be there when the winning runs are scored. Thirty-two away now
tosses it up on leg stump, he stretches forward to block
turn but it's too little too late. Ihsanullah is squared up as he tries to block but the length ball pitching in the rough rips across him and hits his back thigh
goes for the sweep after seeing the ball on a length outside off and hammers it to long leg
tosses it up on leg stump, defends
pitches way too far outside leg - so much that we have the elusive Test match wide
tosses it up on leg stump, Rahmat blunts it
keeps back to a ball on a good length and, because of that slight miscalculation, he has to hurry into his defensive push

big turn again but Ihsanullah brings out the soft hands, not following the ball as it breaks away from him, and bounces sharply too. Defends off the back foot and yanks the bat away too so that a dangerous delivery is smothered well short of slip
full toss on middle, he whips it to deep midwicket
tosses it up on middle, blocks
flighted delivery on middle, easily kept out
presses forward to block outside off
lifts it over cover
appeal for caught and bowled but it's relatively half-hearted The batsman had come down the track, but he'd hit it straight into the ground
full on leg stump, defends
pads up to the ball pitching outside leg. Needless appeal from the Irish
steps into the leg side to slice the good length ball on off stump behind point. Good work from Balbirnie, chasing it down even though it seems like the match is gone
sweeps the ball on his pads strongly to deep square leg
shimmies down the pitch, but Dockrell pulls the length back, beats him in flight and secures an inside edge
lunges forward to the pitch of a full ball outside off and blocks
drags it short and Ihsanullah is quick onto the back foot, opening his shoulders and walloping the ball to deep midwicket
pushes it through outside off, Rahmat punches into the covers
chops the short of a length delivery outside off through the covers
lobs it up on off stump, he drives towards mid-off
digs out a yorker on off stump
clears the front leg so he can carve a ball pitching on leg stump through the covers. Fully in control of a fairly risky stroke
flicks a shortish delivery on leg stump through square leg
half an appeal for lbw from Dockrell, but he's been pitching it well outside leg, so it won't be out
full toss on leg stump, Ihsanullah sweeps it powerfully to deep square leg
goes back to block a good length ball on leg stump
charges down and plonks a tossed up ball back to Dockrell
shortish and outside off, he rocks back and cuts to the right of point
tosses it up on middle, he keeps it out
fires it it outside off, carves it through the covers
fires it into the pads and Ihsanullah is able to flick it through midwicket
full on off stump, defends safely
full on off stump, Rahmat keeps it out
full and outside off, slices it to cover
makes room and cuts an offbreak that seems to deny him the room for this shot, and yet Ihsanullah and his spectacular hands, make a mockery of it all
full and outside off, he drives into the covers
turn and bounce but Ihsanullah backs away again, adjusts to the ball's misbehaviour, and slices it behind point for another boundary. Classy batting
tosses it up on off stump, he blocks
nudges a flatter delivery on off stump to square leg

supremely hit. Rahmat again showing class, slinking deep in his crease to deal with a short and wide delivery and slapping it through extra cover. Doesn't overhit, but always seems to put the bad ball away
tosses it up on middle, he blocks

oooh, he's got the worst luck! Missed his century in the first innings by two runs. Falls with Afghanistan three away from a historic win. Poor Rahmat. He did all the hard work and now with the target one hit away, he goes for that one hit, running down the track and being deceived by the change in length from Cameron-Dow. Swings wildly anyway, all across the line, is beaten by the turn and stumped fairly easily

he's run-out! Oooh, this is silly. And he knows it is, walking back, hitting the air with his bat. Having played a deft little sweep shot, he gets greedy and wants two. Fine leg runs back and to his left quickly enough to stop that and the throw at the strikers' end is pin-point too.

a rasping pull shot over square leg, racing away to the boundary and Shahidi will go down in history as the man who struck the runs that brought Afghanistan's first Test match victory. Punches the air in triumph, goes over to hug his partner, Ihsanullah, and they both soak in the moment.
